required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Exercise & Diet Intervention in Volunteer Firefighters

brief_summary.textblock: The study will explore the capacity for a lifestyle modification in volunteer firefighters to improve blood pressure, blood vessel stiffness, inflammation, and reduce oxidative stress. The study will be a randomized controlled trial with three groups. The interventions will be a weekly circuit workout program including yoga practice, a Mediterranean diet, or a combination.

detailed_description.textblock: Recent statistics from the American Heart Association (AHA) have reported that >92% of adults in the U.S. meet at least 1 metric for cardiovascular disease risk factors. In firefighters, this increased risk is especially concerning. The National Fire Protection Agency (NFPA) estimates there are around 1.3 million firefighters in the United States, 70% of which are volunteer. Every year, almost half of line-of-duty deaths (LODD) are cardiac-related, and the prevalence of impaired cardiovascular health is higher in firefighters than in the general population. It is known that exercise and diet mitigate cardiovascular disease risk. Meeting the physical activity guidelines remains a target of ideal cardiovascular health and a major public health concern. However, the NFPA does not require volunteer fire companies to have a fitness program for their crew, and sadly less than a third of the stations actually do. And importantly, cardiovascular-related LODD remains a major issue in the firefighter population. The results could guide clinical treatment for firefighters and may therefore reduce cardiac-related LODD.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from pre-intervention to post-intervention in blood pressure
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure will be measured by sphygmomanometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from pre-intervention to post-intervention in body composition
secondary_outcome.description: Body composition will be measured by bioelectrical impedance

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from pre-intervention to post-intervention in aerobic fitness levels
secondary_outcome.description: Fitness will be measured by treadmill test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from pre-intervention to post-intervention in inflammation
secondary_outcome.description: Inflammation will be measured by assay of circulating bio-markers through blood draw.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from pre-intervention to post-intervention in core muscular endurance
secondary_outcome.description: Overall core muscular endurance will be measured by prone plank.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from pre-intervention to post-intervention in oxidative stress
secondary_outcome.description: Oxidative stress will be measured by assay of circulating antioxidant bio-markers through blood draw.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Volunteer Firefighter
- Able to Exercise
Exclusion Criteria:
- More than one anti-hypertensive medication
- More than one cholesterol medication
- Diabetic
- Diagnosed heart disease
- Smoker

facility.name: Ursinus College, Health & Exercise Physiology Department
